definition.text: Depthwise separable 2D convolution. Separable convolution consists of first performing a depthwise spatial convolution (which acts on each input channel separately) followed by a pointwise convolution which mixes together the resulting output channels. The depthMultiplier argument controls how many output channels are generated per input channel in the depthwise step.

paragraphs.text: Intuitively, separable convolutions can be understood as a way to factorize a convolution kernel into two smaller kernels, or as an extreme version of an Inception block.
Input shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, channels, rows, cols] if data_format='channelsFirst' or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, rows, cols, channels] if data_format='channelsLast'.

Output shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, filters, newRows, newCols] if data_format='channelsFirst' or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, newRows, newCols, filters] if data_format='channelsLast'. rows and cols values might have changed due to padding.
